intro: Gossypium neglectum, commonly known as wild cotton, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces fluffy, seed-coated capsules that resemble the cotton of cultivated varieties. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential agricultural applications.
